ad_text: Sheridan Memorial Hospital Sponsored NOW HIRING – Spring Nurse Graduates in our MedSurg and the Transitional Care Unit departments. We have an enhanced onboarding for our new graduates. As a new Nurse Graduate, you will be responsible for the assessment, coordination, implementation, and evaluation of the delivery of safe and effective patient-centered care in a variety of settings based on education, knowledge, skill set, and competency. The Registered Nurse communicates with physicians/Managers/co-workers, as appropriate about changes in patient’s clinical condition including results of diagnostic studies and symptomatology. Determines priorities of care based on physical and psychosocial needs. Is able to respond quickly and accurately to changes in condition or response to treatment. Additionally, is able to perform general nursing duties in the departments with adequate supervision. Participates in performance improvement activities. Join our team of skilled and enthusiastic staff at our 5-Star hospital. Located in northern Wyoming, at the base of the beautiful Big Horn Mountains. Sheridan Memorial Hospital is a progressive, state-of-the-art facility dedicated to providing outstanding patient-centered care. We believe that our ability to deliver excellent healthcare begins with our people, and we are proud of our more than 700 experienced and caring employees. We have over 60 physicians who specialize in 20+ areas of expertise. · Sheridan Memorial Hospital – we are passionate about taking care of our families, friends, neighbors and community. Sheridan Memorial Hospital Sponsored NOW HIRING – Revenue Cycle System Specialist in Sheridan, Wyoming at Sheridan Memorial Hospital (SMH). As the Revenue Cycle System Specialist you are highly visible, hands-on position responsible for the analysis, development, implementation, and evaluation of all Revenue Cycle Applications. Assesses and analyzes proposed information technologies to improve management of Revenue Cycle data. Provides systems workflow advice during the implementation processes and provides re-design ideas. Ensures that the technology is being used appropriately, established technical and quality standards are followed, solutions are cost-effective and the information needs of the Revenue Cycle customers are met. Consults with other staff from SMH departments. Uses non-clinical knowledge, clinical knowledge, practice experience and critical thinking to facilitate multidisciplinary approach to promote highly functioning quality care through the various applications within SMH. · Join our team of skilled and enthusiastic staff at our 5-Star hospital.
